subject: RE: [junit] ErrorHandler linkage conflict
msgSnippet: The answer is in the archive. Just search for loader constraints violated and you should find what you need. Thanks, Peter Peter Spitz Team Leader/Senior
messageBody:
The answer is in the archive. Just search for "loader constraints violated"
and you should find what you need.

Thanks,
Peter

Peter Spitz
Team Leader/Senior Software Developer
InSystems Technologies
19 Allstate Parkway, Suite 400
Markham, Ontario
L3R 5A4 Canada
Tel: 905-513-1400 Ext. 3233

> -----Original Message-----
> From: guelp2lolo [mailto:v.d.reijden@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 10, 2002 9:03 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] ErrorHandler linkage conflict
>
>
> Hi
>
> I get the following error message when I run the TestRunner with UI:
>
> java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraints violated when linking
> org/xml/sax/ErrorHandler class
>
> Obviously there's a clash between the ErrorHandler that I use in my
> application code and JUnit, which asssumingly has linked the same
> ErrorHandler, but a different compilation. Anybody out there who
> knows how to solve this conflict?
>
> I'm working with JUnit3.7 and JDK1.4.
>
> If this has been answered before in this group, please forgive me and
> tell me where I find the answer.
>
> Best regards
>
> Frans van der Reijden
>
>
>
